Name: Ready Set Battle
Description:
The zombies have risen from their graves in this epic 2 player game.  Ready Set Battle is easy to learn but takes a zombie lifetime to master.

Play as the humans and try to hold off the zombies to build up your military power and eventually overtake the zombies.  Play the thunder down under card to control the pace of the game, and use your dreaded upgrade card to destroy the zombies forever.

Play as the zombies and come out hitting hard and fast.  Zombie cards keep coming back each round with larger and larger attacks.  Use the zombie dog to give flexibility in the game, and turn your opponent's cards into zombies which really frustrates the opposition.

Win the game by reducing your opponents life to 0.  Will the zombies win with their early attacks or will the humans win by building up their military power?  Get ready to battle in this exciting game!

—description from the designer

Name: Deadzone: Nexus Psi Expansion
Description:
This exciting expansion features two new campaigns for Deadzone. One introduces solo-play - 'Artificial Stupidity' for a series of games against the Zombie hordes. The second campaign focuses around Nexus Psi and the hunt for the origins of the Plague outbreak.

In addition, there are also two new Elite Army lists, introducing new leaders for the Plague and Enforcers - the mutated Dr. Gayle Simmonds and Enforcer Recon Pathfinder N32-19.

This set contains:

1x Dr. Simmonds Exclusive metal model
    10x Plague Zombies
    Nexus Psi Source Book
    2x Urban Scenery A
    1x Urban Scenery Accessories
    1x Landing Pad Scenery B
    1x Defense Line Scenery A
    1x Defense Line Scenery B
    1x Expansion Scenery A
    1x Expansion Scenery B
    1x Connectors

Name: Deadzone: Veer-Myn Faction Starter
Description:
This set contains enough components to build 21 bespoke hard plastic and premium plastic multi-part models, including:

15 Hard Plastic Nightcrawlers or Stalkers
    Malignus Chem Thrower and Chem Spitter Weapon Options
    4 Hard Plastic Nightmares
    Chem Thrower, Big Drill, Heavy Chem Thrower and Two handed Drill Weapon Options
    Premium Plastic Progenitor with Chem Grenade Launcher
    Premium Plastic Progenitor with Spitter Rifle
    25mm and 40mm Plastic Round Bases

Can be used in either Warpath or Deadzone

Name: Deadzone: Nameless Faction Starter
Description:
Mysterious and utterly alien, the Nameless are a bizarre menagerie of tentacles, claws and talons. They have recently turned hostile and begun to invade GCPS space, attacking outposts with their powerful technology and strange abilities.
Contents

This set contains everything you need get started with the Nameless in Deadzone, including:

1 Resin Psychotroid
    2 Plastic Riflemen
    2 Plastic Assassins
    2 Plastic Gunslingers
    2 Plastic Inkers
    2 Plastic Scuttlers
    4 Resin Needle Drones
    1 Resin Caratid
    2 Plastic Ogres
    Transparent Plastic Flying Bases
    25mm and 40mm Round Bases
    Mantic Points

Requires the Deadzone 2nd edition rulebook and Deadzone: Outbreak supplement to play.

Name: Deadzone: GCPS Faction Starter
Description:
The Galactic Co-Prosperity Sphere’s expansion has been swift and reckless, and has now reached the perilous Death Arc. When the Plague bursts upon the colonies, GCPS Marines have to fight for their survival in an uncaring, dangerous galaxy.
Contents

This set contains everything you need get started with the GCPS in Deadzone, including:

1 Metal Major General with Officer's Sword or Energy Gauntlet
    20 Hard Plastic GCPS Troopers/Rangers
    Can be armed with either Laser Rifles or Heavy Laser Rifles
    Optional Flamer, Grenade Launcher and Communications Equipment
    1 Hard Plastic and Metal GCPS Engineer
    2 Hard Plastic and Metal GCPS Anti-Infantry Weapon Teams
    Either team can be armed with a Mortar or Autocannon
    25mm and 60mm Plastic and MDF Round Bases
    Rules Leaflet including full stats and rules for fielding the GCPS in Deadzone
    Mantic Points

Requires the Deadzone 2nd Edition Rulebook to play.

Name: Siege of Izmail
Description:
Siege of Izmail is a two-player game recreating the storming of the Ottoman fortress Izmail, situated on the Danube River, by Russian forces under the command of General Alexander Suvorov. This battle occurred on 22 December 1790.

—description from the designer

Name: The Last Frontier
Description:
1. Roll the die. Move as many spaces as the die indicates. (Boats, planes, and Whales are the same as squares and circles, and are counted as one move.) When starting, a player may move in any direction they choose. from villages or cities a player may move in any direction, even retracing the previous route, but a player may not change direction between cities or villages (the circles are not the only points of direction change.)

2. When a player lands on a city or village ( circles) they receive the Commerce or Adventure card for that place. The points or dollars are then added to that players score. Each card is worth different amounts of dollars or points. The points are converted to dollars for scoring purposes as follows:
1 Adventure point = $100.00

If a player rolls the die and lands on a place already occupied, the player occupying that place is "bumped" to the nearest Hazard. The "Bumped" player then has to select a Hazard card and follow the instructions on it for his/her next move. A player may choose to "Homestead". (Decision can be made after a roll, and only twice in each game.) lose one turn each time you become a Homesteader.

3. Any player Landing on a plane may "Fly" to any city or village on the game board.

4. Any player landing on a Hazard selects a hazard card follows the instructions. Once used, the cards are returned to the stack face up on the bottom.

5. Commerce and Adventure cards are kept by the players when received (if the game is not complete by the time the cards are out, players will return their cards to the Banker and continue the game to completion.)

6. The first player to accumulate $5,000.00 and returns to starting point wins the game!

(Note)
If two players are playing, we suggest the score be raised to $10,000.00 to make it more interesting and challenging.

When one player reaches the $5,000.00 or ($10,000.00) point, it's up to the rest of the players to prevent him/her from returning to the starting point by whatever means they can.

Name: Independence.....
Description:
Canary islands are independent... The next day, Spain strikes. Each turn they head towards your cities and each turn you try to stop them. If you hold on them for 2 days,they"ll retreat and you will win. If they occupy your main city by the 2nd day,they'll win.

—description from the designer

Name: Launch Bay Escape
Description:
It's been 30 years since the last uprising of the Zraxii Empire was beaten down by the brave troops of the Terra Republic. Applying for the mission with the codename "Elite Peacekeeping Shockwave" sounded glorious at first, but turned out being a little bit dull as patrolling a remote part of the galaxy without any upbeat outposts did not motivate the crew greatly. Instead, one of the most stimulating activities became the weekly BBQ on the electric fire in the dust-heavy unused launch bay, within the protective shield of the XP95 fighter craft. Today's menu included some deep space frozen Milky Way cow meat, discovered on an abandoned vessel near the dwarf planet Taplor 4.

"RRAARRRAARR!" — The ship's alarm was blazing.

Only after a few important wasted moments did the squad realize this was not a test as they found themselves between the run wild XP95 fighter, filled with enough explosives to destroy a small moon, and the marching forces of the until now assumed defeated Zraxii Empire trying to board the ship. Luckily the squad's exceptionally extensive combat training and experience came in handy, if only they had kept up training regularly...

Launch Bay Escape is a ridiculous co-operative game featuring planning that's enriched with a small deck-building mechanism. It's suitable for space soldiers from the age of 10 and takes about 30-45 minutes. The difficulty level is easily adjustable per game as you increase the complexity by adding more and more aliens, obstacles, and madness.

The game is played in rounds. At the start of the game a rectangular game board divided in rows of squares is placed. One end features the launching ship and the starting area for the players, the other end features the Launch Bay exit. All players have their own character sheet and corresponding deck, and all players have their own special abilities, number of hit points and shield. Players start with six cards in their hand. At the start of a round, all players plan three cards from the available cards in their hand, face down. Next, the first card of all players is revealed. All cards show a number, movement options, and special abilities. In order of highest to lowest number, every player follows the instructions on their planned card. When all cards are resolved, the ship moves one row towards the Launch Bay exit and all aliens move once towards the ship and attack. This is repeated for both remaining planned cards. At the end of the round, all planned cards and remaining cards in the player's hand are discarded and a new hand of six cards is drawn. Once damage accumulates, some cards will be planned randomly.

Players can gain experience by killing aliens. Experience enables the players to buy extra cards to add to their deck. In addition, players may find items on the game board, usable only once or multiple times.

The players lose if the ship or all the players are destroyed before reaching the escape pods at the end of the Launch Bay.

—description from publisher

Name: Wall Jumper
Description:
The aim of the game is to jump the wooden pieces over a wall into the holes of the playing board and to score as many points as possible.
On her/his turn, each player has 3 attempts to flick one of the pieces into one of the holes. In order to do this, the player has to slide one of the provided springboards into the slits in the wall, place the pieces on it and flick it over the wall (hopefully into the net).
Jumping height, distance and direction depend on the following:

     How deep and in which angle the springboard is slid into the wall
     The placing of the springboard in the wall
     The power with which the springboard is pushed down


—user summary

Name: Mind the Gap (fan expansion for MBT: Second Edition)
Description:
NOTE:  This game is no longer for sale.

***All briefings and maps can be downloaded from the files section of this page for free.  The maps should be printed on 12 x 18 inch paper to produce an 11 x 17 inch map.***

"Mind the Gap" depicts a never fought 1979 engagement in the Fulda Gap using Jim Day's and GMT’s MBT Game pitting a reinforced US Armored Cavalry Troop from the 11th Armored Cavalry Regiment “The Black Horse” against a reinforced Motorized Rifle Battalion equipped with BMP-2 and T-64BV Tanks.

The scenario reflects my experience as a Platoon Leader in the gap as a tank and armored cavalry platoon leader and troop XO  in the 1st Squadron, 11th ACR stationed in Fulda from January 1977 – December 1979.  The game is not balanced although players may balance it as they deem fit.  The actual fight was not; we had a healthy respect for the quantity, if not the quality, of the enemy.

To play the game, you must have a copy of the initial GMT MBT Game.  The expansion includes a new map of four 11 x 17 inch map sheets scaled at 100 meters per hex (the same scale as the MBT game).  The map is based on a period map of the battle area and utilizes contours to depict elevation.

The Scenario Briefing, a B Troop and Soviet Battle Books with deployment instructions, and alternate order of battle listings, a planning map and terrain key are downloadable from the files section.

Expansion sets are not required (BAOR, FRG, and the forthcoming Canadian supplement) provide additional vehicle counters as well as leaders.  A list of substitute counters is provided to enable the player to field the complete order of battle for both sides or the players can use some of the expansion set vehicles or combine sets to complete the order of battle.

Mind the Gap can be played with two players but may be more interesting if played with up to 6 players on the US side (CO and the five platoon leaders), and 6 on the USSR side (Battalion Commander and 4 company commanders), and a referee.

The gamer can also simulate a 1978 engagement by downloading a Vehicle Card for the M60A1 tank from https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/146576/official-bonus-data-card-um-13b-m60a1-aos and by deleting the M901 Improved TOW vehicles from the US Order of Battle

Mind the Gap© 2018 StrongPoint Simulations and Modeling, LLC.  •    MBT™ is arbitrable to James M. Day.
The MBT Game ©2016 GMT Games.
Counter images are used with permission of James M. Day.

Name: Not Yet Lost: The Defense of the Polish Post Office in Danzig
Description:
Not Yet Lost (NYL) is a quick playing solitaire print-and-play game depicting the heroic defense of the Polish Post Office in Danzing during the German invasion in September, 1939. Using a chit-pull system, the player defends against increasing numbers of German attackers over the course of 15 turns. The player's success is measured by the length of time (in turns) that the Germans are repulsed. With each fighting turn that the defenders survive, Poland is not yet lost.

-description from designer

Name: Super Meat Boy: Rival Rush
Description:
Super Meat Boy Rival Rush is a one versus one competitive card game where Players race to the finish. Players assemble twenty card decks comprised of actions and skills that will get them to the end, along with some nasty tricks to trip up their opponent. Beloved characters from the Super Meat Boy Cinematic Universe make appearances for the first time as trading cards, each with their own unique abilities and powers to help navigate the levels ahead at breakneck speeds. Rival Rush is a nonstop fast paced no holds barred finger blistering every card for themselves showdown where only the swiftest and smartest survive.

Taking heavy influence in the micro-deck builder genre, the game puts the players in the task of creating a deck of cards that matches the symbols that pop up in the "stages" in front of us. The trick? Your rival might guess which card you have chosen for this turn and could block your moves through the stages; and in Rival Rush there will be only ONE winner.

Taking in consideration that the game offers the possibility of a fresh experience every time it's played thanks to it's random generated levels (constructed from the cards themselves), Rival Rush seems like a very fun and competitive way of enjoying Super Meat Boy; hopefully not as frustrating as it's digital counterpart.

Name: G.F.Y.
Description:
GFY is an easy-to-learn, fast-paced card game in the spirit of Mario Kart. The rules are simple, but winning is never easy, especially at a table with experienced players. GFY makes a perfect gift for anyone in college or the military.

Each player start with 7 cards and your goal is to be the first to get rid of your cards, that is how the game ends.

On your turn draw 1 card and play 1 card, doing exactly what the card's rules say to do. Typically, this will be to discard more cards, draw more cards, or give or take cards from another player. If you can't do it exactly, you can not play it. If you can't play anything, draw a 2nd card and end your turn.

Name: I Know How You Died
Description:
This game was made as a form of giving back to our fans and supporters. Yes, it's FREE! You can get the Print N Play file simply by subscribing your email to Medieval Lords. We love to spread fun and joy (perhaps death and destruction too, in this case) It is wild, so expect to laugh lots when you play - more so if your friends are horrible actors! Alternatively, you can get the game professionally printed over at The Game Crafter here: https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/i-know-how-you-died1 (Cost-to-cost price by Game Crafter with zero profit for us) This game is intended for pure utter rubbish type of casual fun, don't go in expecting any serious game play! Play this with the wrong crowd and you'd end up in an awkward evening!

Players are issued 3 random secret cards depicting various deaths, and they must choose one of them to re-enact. Then after everyone has done a quick 5 to 10 seconds re-enactment of their chosen scene, they toss these cards (still face-down) into a common pile in the middle of the table. Shuffle the pile and reveal the top card to everyone. If anyone wants to guess at who had acted out the death scene of that particular card, simply say 'I know!' and call out that player's name. This is on a first-come-first-serve basis. Note that the actual actor of the card cannot guess his/her own card, but must pretend to participate so as not to give the answer away.

If a scene was guessed correctly the first time, the guesser gains 4 Point. If a scene was guessed correctly the second time, the guesser gains 3 Point. The actor also gets 3 Points. All wrong guesses will deduct 1 Point from the guesser.

If no one got the correct answer to a scene after two attempts, the next scene is drawn and the game continues. After 3 scenes, the entire pile is discarded completely and a new round begins. This also means there will be some scenes that do not show up despite having been acted out. This is to increase the difficulty of the game.

The game ends when the last card is drawn, or when someone achieves 20 or more Points. Rules can be found at the Files section of this game page.

Have fun dying...

Name: Take a Pic
Description:
The photo safari on the game board is open, so keep your eyes open and cameras on!

In Take a Pic, dice indicate which animals can be seen this round and you must be the first one who takes a picture. Don't forget to protect pictures on your flash card because competitors don't slumber!

The game includes two big dice with animals and a photographer (joker) on their faces, and the animals on the round cards represent what you see through your camera lens. Now it's time to find out who is faster. Say cheese!

Name: BATTALIA NCBC: Velik-an
Description:
Suddenly a harsh voice crashed over the mountains: "I will spare the pity life of every minor creature in this land who obeys me! I could even like some of you, if they stay calm in my herd and supply me well. The rest of you should try me and suffer my anger!" Very large and gorgeous miniature of the Giant: Velik-an, who demands tributes from the players every day in order to leave them be... But not everyone is obliged to pay his price, you can always try to fight him until the giant's total defeat or temporary repel.


    NCBC is a collection of mini expansions based on neutral big scale figurines, which are designed to enlarge the immersive Battalia universe, introducing a whole bunch of new strategic possibilities to the players and adding completely new adventure elements to the basically competitive plot. In general they don't belong to any faction (resp. to any player) and can be played in different combinations with the basic game or with the BIG!Expansion. We don't recommend to mix more than 3 different types of NPCs in your games in order to avoid higher complexity. But you can mix them in totally different combinations, which ensures the long-term replayability and excitement in this game universe. Normally the NPCs have small complementary rules, which are provided only online on Battalia's home page battalia.eu as high resolution printable PDF files. The miniatures are distributed in small packaging boxes with custom artwork as separate items or possibly in bundles.

Name: BATTALIA NCBC: Souleater
Description:
Run!
If you see him... run!
If you only smell his presence... run!
If you feel his malice, run... and don't look back!
He is unstoppable 
He is the pure evil and 
He wants to feed on your soul forever!
Give it a chance! Save it... run!
.... cause he is the SOULEATER: The Hunger Himself!

Name: BATTALIA NCBC: Mistress of the Mist
Description:
Large and gorgeous miniature of the Mistress of the Mist. The wandering enchantress, always attracted by the building and expanding of cities... She was born as the only daughter of a Cloudborn master-builder and her love for architecture and building arts remained forever. But the fate brought her later to an eastern magical school, where she learned the arts to cover and defend huge places with a misty veil, the perfect protection for cities against enemy attacks. But every coin is double sided, that's why sometimes her positive intentions cause more trouble than real good...

Name: BATTALIA NCBC: Moodies
Description:
"If you're small and wayward, it doesn't mean that you are useless, right...? Ok, it's not always easy for the master, because we're a bit erratic too and we always want to be fed, fed, fed... otherwise unhappy and this means, bad support for the master and short list of possible wishes.... But if we're happy and in a good mood - master will be satisfied too, this means - long list of wishes for happy master... And last but not least - we are very jealous and just need to be "THE ONE AND ONLY" for the master!"

Name: BATTALIA NCBC: Krampling vs Oracle Knight
Description:
Battalia is the perfect land to live on with its beautiful nature on the surface... but down there, deep underground rules the Blight and Kramplings are dwelling in the tunnels. Now they want to crawl out from their forsaken wells, spoil the Stormgates and taint the vicinity. All living creatures and plants shall die or become weaker... All movements in their range will be harder and the worst part is - they fear no ordinary hero, but only the Oracle Knights....

... Only a few of them left during the years - not every man is able to bear this burden. Their life is not their own, their cause is the eternal pledge - they are the noble order of the Oracle Knights. Only they posses the secret formula, the power of the ancient spell, which heals the corruption and frightens the Kramplings to death. Their weapons were forged with a magic adjuration able to overcome the aura of the beasts and to destroy them... Eternal secret since the dawn of time...

Name: Masterplan
Description:
[English]
Masterplan is a competitive city building game where the players impersonate a construction entrepreneur who is willing to be the most influential one in the urbanization process of the new neighborhood.

During your turn, you can use your workers to perform different actions: you can auction for new building plans or construction sites, start a new building using those plans and sites, or use special actions from neutral buildings.

Each building you finish will modify its surroundings, because no one wants to live near the noisy factory, but having a mall just across the street will make your tenants happy. Plan your neighborhood carefully so your buildings are happier than your rivals. Go for a business area or develop the factories, but be ready to modify your plans when the other players start building near you.

After a set number of rounds, all of the points from your constructed buildings will be tallied, and the best architect will we declared winner.

-description from publisher
 [Spanish]
Masterplan es un juego de construcción de ciudades competitivo en el que los jugadores se pondrán en la piel de un empresario de la construcción que quiere ser el más influyente en el proceso de urbanización del nuevo barrio.

Durante tu turno, puedes usar tus trabajadores para realizar diferentes acciones: puedes entrar en subastas para conseguir nuevos planos o solares, comenzar nuevos edificios con dichos planos y solares, o usar acciones especiales de los edificios neutrales.
Cada edificio que completes modificará sus alrededores, ya que nadie quiere vivir cerca de una ruidosa fábrica, pero vivir justo enfrente del centro comercial hará tus inquilinos más felices. Planifica tu vecindario cuidadosamente para que tus edificios sean más felices que los de tus rivales. Céntrate en crear una zona de negocios, o desarrolla las fábricas, pero estate preparado para modificar tus planes cuando los otros jugadores comiencen a construir cerca de ti.

Tras un número de rondas determinado, se contarán los puntos de tus edificios construidos, y el mejor arquitecto será declarado ganador.

Name: BATTALIA NCBC: The Order of the Half Oracle
Description:
Dishearter - She is tough and she is pretty, but cold as a stone and fully committed to her pledge. She belongs to the Order of the Half Oracle and would always try to "turn" you. Dishearter will charm you first and try to convince you to follow her path... but if you reject... She would take your courage away, consume your faith and moral and leave you wretched and miserable. She is able to do that... The main rule of the Order teaches: If you are not with us, you're against us!

Truth-squeezer - Are you willing to tell the truth? Dare you to hide it? It's your choice, just always be prepared to meet the Truth-Squeezer ... Do you believe you're ready to face him and listen to him, hissing in your ear: Knowledge is power, but the truth could be your weakness...  I know how to squeeze it from you.... The Order will prize my efforts, since I always hear their call: Remove all obstacles!

Challenger - Large and very detailed miniature of a fanatics challenger, another great NPC, which offers new style of adventures... Meeting you, he will challenge you, will always try to seduce your natural born greed for success, he will play with your moral and conscience and finally he will let you no choice, but to make one very hard decision.... It's always about the same old dilemma: Victory or Defeat - and are you willing to pay the price for it?

Name: BATTALIA NCBC: The Keeper
Description:
Large scale miniature of the almighty lord of battle, the master of all surges, The Missing Element himself. The Keeper emerges always on every battlefield to reward the victor in the combat with one of the elemental keys.

Alternative game end condition - playing with this figure introduces new game end condition! The game ends when someone gathers the necessary number of keys, plus 4 cities level 4. Moreover, the game does not end when the map is fully covered.

Alternative win condition - in this game it is not enough to have the most points. Only the players that have gathered all necessary keys can claim the victory - they are the only ones who compare their score.

Name: Il gioco dell'orso
Description: An ancient abstract board game from Italy, the Valle Cervo. It's an asymetrical hunting game. Three hounds hunt a bear, moving from point to point on a special board. The bear needs to escape getting cornered for 40 moves.

Name: BATTALIA NCBC: Unbound Buff
Description:
Large and gorgeous miniature of the wild and restless NPC mercenary leader, who enters the map randomly through roads from outside the border lands and automatically attacks every hero on his way….To deal with him, every player has a couple of choices: Of course you can fight him, or you could try to bribe him or even hire him for a week...
