Name: BATTALIA NCBC: The Ruin Guards
Description:
Gorgeous figurine of the mighty ancient guards of the ruins - a NPC which belongs to no player, but will be aggressive to all heroes. The figure will come out of the ruins from time to time and will be moved according to a special rule. The guards will try to curse you, making troubles on the map, and to collect back all the Great Artefacts from the players.


    NCBC is a collection of mini expansions based on neutral big scale figurines, which are designed to enlarge the immersive Battalia universe, introducing a whole bunch of new strategic possibilities to the players and adding completely new adventure elements to the basic competitive plot. In general they don't belong to any faction (resp. to any player) and can be played in different combinations with the basic game or with the BIG!Expansion. We don't recommend to mix more than 3 different types of NPCs in your games in order to avoid higher complexity. But you can mix them in totally different combinations, which ensures the long-term replay ability and excitement in this game universe. Normally the NPCs have small complementary rules, which are provided only online on Battalia's home page battalia.eu as high resolution printable PDF files. The miniatures are distributed in small packaging boxes with custom artwork as separate items or possibly in bundles.

Name: Lemmify
Description:
The aim of the game is to get your family of 3 across the valley of death to the safety of their new home.

To do this you have 2 dice, you can use the number as one whole number for one Lemming or you can split the dice and move two lemmings (sticking to the numbers on the dice please!!) as you move along you must avoid rivers, canyons, forest fires and the ubiquitous Random Encounters which can be good or bad! However, you can navigate the terrain using Save or Play cards specific to each obstacle. For example, rivers can be used as normal squares if you have a boat, Lem Cardashian's floating but, or a Child's birthday balloon. Save or Play cards can also save you from predators such as the Lemming Chainsaw Massacre which prevents you from being eaten by mountain lions, snakes, or being trampled by an angry bull BUT you can only use one card per one lemming (then the card goes back to the bottom of the pack) so use them wisely to get your lemmings to safety.

As you move around the board the risks are greater AND if at any point you land on a space with another teams lemming you must battle it out for territory by rolling one die each, the one with the least has to move back the number they rolled, but beware of landing on Random Encounters and other Lemmings because you must keep going until you are safe.

The game builds in tension as the players begin to reach their new home because you are now in a position where you don’t have the option to choose which lemming you move, beware friends and family as you get closer to winning they might have a mean streak you didn’t know about and use a Save or Play card against another player.

This board game pits you against your family and friends in a fun but strategic game, it’s your job to know which Lemming to move and when to strike in order to get home first. As the game progresses the stakes are higher - Lemmy is counting on you!

-description from designer

Name: Starcadia Quest: Showdown
Description:
Starcadia Quest: Showdown is a brand-new expansion that complements not only Starcadia Quest but also plugs into the Arcadia Quest series as well! Showdown is not about going on an arduous quest to defeat evil monsters, no siree! Showdown introduces a new mode: full Player-versus-Player deathmatches that will see players draft & pick all-new Upgrade tokens and enter a vicious arena to battle enemy Crews!

The action in Showdown takes place in a Double-sided Game Board, with one side designed for 3-4 players, and a 2 players version on the back. With its tight corridors and sharp turns, the Crews (and Guilds) will see themselves immersed into non-stop action! Only 1 Stimpack, 1 Recharge Token and 2 Computer Terminals are still functioning in the arena and sometimes become contested hotspots. In Showdown, the Crews don’t claim Victory by accumulating Victory Points: the first Crew that manages to score 3 Kills is deemed Victorious!

Thanks to the Hollow Deck technology, Starcadians can conjure up the legendary Heroes from ancient Arcadia to test their mettle! With 60 Hero cards and 4 Crew Dashboards (sporting an appropriately battle-damaged look and slots for Pets and Mounts!) players with any Arcadia Quest core box (Classic or Inferno) or with the Starcadia Quest core box can join the Showdown!

—description from the publisher

Name: BATTALIA NCBC: Armamentum
Description:
Highly Effective city walls defense weapons. A must have in some situations, especially when playing with the rampaging Rammoth Deleo-arx. Increases the security of your city against random NPC attacks and could be used in player vs. player interactions in different scenarios.


    NCBC is a collection of mini expansions based on neutral big scale figurines, which are designed to enlarge the immersive Battalia universe, introducing a whole bunch of new strategic possibilities to the players and adding completely new adventure elements to the basic competitive plot. In general they don't belong to any faction (resp. to any player) and can be played in different combinations with the basic game or with the BIG!Expansion. We don't recommend to mix more than 3 different types of NPCs in your games in order to avoid higher complexity. But you can mix them in totally different combinations, which ensures the long-term replayability and excitement in this game universe. Normally the NPCs have small complementary rules, which are provided only online on Battalia's home page battalia.eu as high resolution printable PDF files. The miniatures are distributed in small packaging boxes with custom artwork as separate items or possibly in bundles.

Name: BATTALIA NCBC: Rammoth Deleo-Arx
Description:
Ready for defense! The rampaging Rammoth called Deleo-Arx is about to smash your city gates and bombard with ballista arrows the city walls at the same time. You will need special support of defensive weapons in order to hold the city level status.


    NCBC is a collection of mini expansions based on neutral big scale figurines, which are designed to enlarge the immersive Battalia universe, introducing a whole bunch of new strategic possibilities to the players and adding completely new adventure elements to the basic competitive plot. In general they don't belong to any faction (resp. to any player) and can be played in different combinations with the basic game or with the BIG!Expansion. We don't recommend to mix more than 3 different types of NPCs in your games in order to avoid higher complexity. But you can mix them in totally different combinations, which ensures the long-term replay ability and excitement in this game universe. Normally the NPCs have small complementary rules, which are provided only online on Battalia's home page battalia.eu as high resolution printable PDF files. The miniatures are distributed in small packaging boxes with custom artwork as separate items or possibly in bundles.

Name: BATTALIA NCBC: Star-Smuggler Morgenstern
Description:
Say hello to the deal of the century! This guy operates almost like a genie in a bottle. He is able to exchange old artefacts for new ones at the best possible rate... and for now he is the only one who has access to the most precious substance in the universe called STAR-DUST. It is similar to the supply cards, but with double value! He is always strolling around the Gates. Catch him if you can!


    NCBC is a collection of mini expansions based on neutral big scale figurines, which are designed to enlarge the immersive Battalia universe, introducing a whole bunch of new strategic possibilities to the players and adding completely new adventure elements to the basic competitive plot. In general they don't belong to any faction (resp. to any player) and can be played in different combinations with the basic game or with the BIG!Expansion. We don't recommend to mix more than 3 different types of NPCs in your games in order to avoid higher complexity. But you can mix them in totally different combinations, which ensures the long-term replay ability and excitement in this game universe. Normally the NPCs have small complementary rules, which are provided only online on Battalia's home page battalia.eu as high resolution printable PDF files. The miniatures are distributed in small packaging boxes with custom artwork as separate items or possibly in bundles.

Name: Tower: Market Inventory Randomizers
Description:
18 round inventory marker tokens that are meant to be placed directly over the existing inventory spaces on the six market stall tiles included with Tower.

Includes instructions for use.

It randomizes what the markets will sell in the game.

Name: Super Munchkin 1+2
Description:
With 112 cards to enhance your Super Munchkin game, The Narrow S Cape is much more than just this season's favorite fashion accessory! It teems with new villains like the contemptible Cheese Wiz, Gothzilla (with earthquake-causing platform boot action!), and the Ratwoman. And lest you feel overwhelmed by villainy, this expansion also features new items, new Powers and a new Class: the Brain!

This game combines Super Munchkin and Super Munchkin 2.

Früher war es ein niedliches Munchkin-Spiel. Aber dann wurde es in mysteriösen Energien gebadet, von einem radioaktiven Chihuahua gebissen und fasste ein uraltes Götzenbild an. Nun fliegt es durch Super-City und kämpft für eherne Werte wie Wahrheit, Gerechtigkeit und noch höhere Boni! Schlüpf in die Rolle eines Superhelden und sei ein Mutant, ein Exot, ein Mystiker, ein Techno oder ein Superhirn. Je höher deine Stufe ist, desto mehr Superkräfte kannst du haben. Bekämpfe niederträchtige Teufelsgenies, verheerende Monster und aus anderen Dimensionen einfallende Außerirdische – vom läppischen Explodoman über Jürgen von der Grippe bis hin zum Großen Alten Planetenfresser – UND NIMM IHR ZEUG! Wenn du deine Unterwäsche drüber trägst, eine Lizenz zum Verwüsten hast und alle mit deinen Monologen langweilst, kann kein Feind vor dir bestehen!

Die Erweiterung Coole Capes ist in Super Munchkin bereits enthalten.

Name: Spiel mir das Lied vom Munchkin 1+2
Description:
The Good, the Bad, and the Munchkin 2: Beating a Dead Horse contains 56 new Wild West-themed cards specifically for use in The Good, the Bad, and the Munchkin, although they can also be added to any other Munchkin game.

This expansion includes a new class, Cavalry, that allows you to sacrifice your treasure to gain a level when helping a non-Cavalry player. Since this level is gained as part of a combat, it can be the winning level.

This game combines The Good, the Bad, and the Munchkin and 
The Good, the Bad, and the Munchkin 2: Beating a Dead Horse.

Als ich aus Alabama kam, fi el der Regen dick und schwer, und ich hatte keine Waffe und auch gar kein Goldstück mehr. Meine Braut hab’ ich verlassen, doch ich konnte nix dafür. Denn das größte Glück des Munchkins lauert hinter einer Tür … Oh Susanna, das Munchkinleben ist nicht schwer. Jetzt hab’ ich schicke Sachen an und ein geiles Schießgewehr!

Spiel mir das Lied vom Munchkin verlegt das klassische Munchkintum in den Wilden Westen! Spielt Cowboy und Indianer, Gesetzlose und Städter. Tragt Duelle mit Daniel Boom, dem Wolpertinger oder mit dem Mördermäßigen Jalapeño aus! Setzt euch den Großen Cowboyhut auf und steckt euch den Sheriffstern an … Bewaffnet euch bis an die Zähne mit der Kanone aus dem Bürgerkrieg und dem Kuhfl aden … Sattelt dann noch die Rösser und trommelt eure Handlanger zusammen, und sogleich könnt ihr wieder staubige Türen eintreten! Auch hier gibt es wieder Monster zum Töten und Schätze zum Einsacken – Yee-HAW!

Die Erweiterung Zu Tode geritten ist in dieser Ausgabe bereits enthalten. Wir machen sie damit erstmals auf Deutsch zugänglich.

Name: Beasts of Balance: Kickstarter Promo Battle Cards
Description:
This Kickstarter Promo contains 2 new Battle Cards, Divine Rewind and Friendly Fire.

Divine Rewind: Select a Beast. It transforms into an earlier version of itself.

Friendly Fire: The next 15 seconds of volcano damage will instead give life to your Beasts.

The prototypes of these cards were called Theory of Devolution and Lava-Va-Voom! respectively.

Name: Blood Red Skies: German – Junkers JU-88 A Bomber
Description:
Originally designed as a Schnellbomber (fast Bomber) the Junker JU88 became Germany's most successful multi-role combat aircraft in World War II. The production ran from 1936 to 1945 and over 16,000 were built, more than any other twin-engine plane in the Luftwaffe. Miniatures are supplied unpainted and some assembly may be required

Contents:

3 Junkers JU-88 A German Bombers
3 Decal Sheets
3 Advantage Flying Base & Extension
3 Double-sided Pilot Skill Discs
1 Aircraft Card
1 Assembly Instruction Leaflet
Families: History: World War II (Battle of Britain)

Name: Something Is Missing
Description:
Something Is Missing is a picture book written and illustrated in Taiwan that has now been adapted into a memory dexterity game. This game not only provides you with the book's images faithfully represented, but also brings you back to experience Taiwan's rich traditional culture.

Through the game, players are invited to carefully appraise the images, and the one to first successfully recall the missing object scores. Through this lighthearted 3-7 player game, everyone can experience both fun and nostalgia for the past.

Name: Exploding Kittens: Streaking Kittens
Description:
Streaking Kittens is the second expansion for Exploding Kittens, the award-winning card game that made Kickstarter history as the most-backed project, ever.

This expansion deck includes 15 cards, featuring 8 new types of actions and a Streaking Kitten which allows you to hold an Exploding Kitten in your hand without exploding.

Name: Urban Insanity
Description:
Urban Insanity is the game where the board changes every time you play.

128 game-play variations are available, from endless destruction to mind-bending strategy... and all with the same basic rules!

Work together to complete a city map... until it's time to score points! Compete to complete city blocks, streets, suburbs, and stadiums. Dial up the madness with one or more of the 6 expansion packs. Create a mobster turf war, an alien invasion, light your city on fire, and much more.

Each turn consists of drawing an action card and playing a tile. In a single round everything can change!

This fast-paced game combines strategy, luck, and something something something.

We debuted in the game room at DragonCon 2018, and were an instant hit!

We've created a couple videos for your enjoyment, so take a moment to see what we've cooked up!

—description from the publisher

Name: Rune Walker: A Solitaire Rune Game
Description:
Rune Walker is a game of discovery and adventure using a standard set of 24 runes. It draws upon the ancient myths of the Teutonic peoples in order to present a world of heroism and challenge.  Each step matters in this world where Jotuns intend to thwart the Rune Walker and her attempt to reclaim the wisdom of the nine worlds.  The Rune Walker will face opponents of immense and growing power armed with lore and weapons of great strength.  The object of Rune Walker is to succeed in walking all nine worlds and to rebuild the great world tree – Yggdrasil.  When all nine worlds have been placed upon Yggdrasil the game is won and the Rune Walker has claimed the wisdom of the Runes and worlds.

- A Game for One Player

—description from the designer

Name: Champions of the Internet
Description:
Champions of the Internet is a party card game with real pics of the biggest champs to ever grace the internet!

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
People Cards: the most diverse, awesome deck of real people! You never know what type of person you're gonna get- fitness fanatics, body modifiers, drag queens, moms, models... you name it, we've got it!

Question Cards: Our Question Cards are hilarious and cover a wide range of topics- scary stuff, sexy stuff, sweet stuff. Plus, our added hashtags make them even funnier!

HOW TO PLAY
All players draw 5 People Cards. One player acts as the judge for the round and reads aloud a Question Card. The other players put down one People Card that they think best answers the question. It's up to the judge to pick their favorite played People Card. The player whose card was chosen wins the round! Play as many rounds as you desire.

5 GAMES IN ONE BOX
There are actually multiple games you can play! Inside the box, you’ll also learn how to play Slap That Ass, Bed Wed Dead, Identity Crisis and The Final Rose.

-description from designer

Name: Mythos
Description:
Welcome to Mythos, a H.P. Lovecraft inspired 1920’s horror skirmish game.

In Providence U.S.A a City like many other, the stage is set for what could be the first battle for the very survival of every last man, woman and child of Humanity. A war is coming, though not like the one that ended but a few years ago. An ancient being stirs in the deep, something so powerful that if it were to awaken, it would wipe out Humanity in the blink of an eye.

â€‹The Sea Queen has been given the task and sent forth her best, they have made their way to land and now walk amongst you attempting to blend in as they scout this world above the water.

Other creatures born in the wild have been drawn to the area, the woods and forests are their realm and they are fiercely protective of them. They strengthen their numbers with sacrificial magic and awaken the old things of the forest best left sleeping.

Guardians from a long past age have been shipped by chance or fate to the town, their chittering growing in volume as they begin to awaken from their hibernation.

Cultists find key points of power for summoning. Their decades long work finally paying dividends as they close on the secret to moving beyond human form and finding the path of enlightenment that will see them become gods.

And finally, the defenders of Humanity, long since forgotten but still ever vigilant. The prophets have spoken, the signs of something dark and powerful are plain to see and they will not stand idly by but will fight to their dying breath against the coming darkness.

This skirmish game will see two or more players take to the table top to play one of the core game types, or one of the story solo/campaign games of Mythos.
 Each faction member is unique, coming not only with their own stats, Mythos abilities and traits but also a second side to their nature. Some will reveal this as insanity takes hold, others will be triggered by certain effects and interactions. Each turn players will alternate their activation's using up all the action points of each character. ‘Live combat’ will see that not every fight goes your way even if you started it, blasting your foes with ranged or arcane attacks may see them dodge away, taking that valuable item with them as they do.

Balancing your Mythos use will be key, as each point spent also takes away a point of sanity and once you go insane there’s no coming back but it’s not always a bad thing.

So, are you up for the challenge, to take the fight to your faction’s enemies, to put the objective before all else and push past your sanity threshold until all you see is red and insanity takes you?
â€‹
Yes, then welcome to Mythos!

—description from the publisher

Name: Captain Can Spell
Description:
The First Word Climbing Game

Captain Can Spell is a word game with innovative game rules. It is easy to learn and fun. Besides this game will test your word skills, it also involves layers of strategy for you to discover. This game will fit all word game lovers, from beginner to expert.

Gameplay overview (2 players):

Each player is dealt 13 cards, the aim is to get rid of all cards, players take turns to play a word. All words are ranked, from lowest to highest, by their first letter in alphabetical order. Player in turn must play a word of the same ranking or higher than the previous player. For example, the previous player played "book", the next player can play "bat" or "cat, dog, eagle...zoo", but this player cannot play "apple" due to "A" is lower in rank than "B". If this player cannot or does not want to play a word in his/her turn, then he/she has to pass and draw two cards from the draw pile. After a pass, the next player can play any new word.

Scoring system:

The player who gets rid of all cards wins the round, the losing player has to take the penalty points which is the number of cards in his/her hand plus the number of cards remains in the draw pile, 1 point each. This will add up to his/her total penalty points. When one of the players reaches the total penalty points of 100, the player with less penalty points wins the game.

3-4 players game:

This game can be played up to 4 players with the slightly modified game rules in which involves some different strategies of playing.

—description from the designer

Name: Handimonium: The Tiny Hands Game
Description:
Players or teams compete to see who can complete the most tasks while using the small, doll-like hands provided.

There are three different ways to play the game: Relay, Battle, and Charades. You can choose how you want to play depending on how many players you have. Each of the Challenge cards includes a challenge that can be used in Relay or Battle gameplay and one Charade.

In Relay play, which is for four or more players, teams compete to be the first to complete five challenges using the tiny hands. Player 1 on the team does the first challenge, and then passes the hands to player 2 who completes the second challenge and passes the hands to the third player for the third challenge, and so on. The first team to finish five challenges wins.

If you only have two players, you can Battle. Players go head-to-head to see who can complete a challenge first. You score one point if you do. The first player to earn five points wins.

And for three or more players, you can play Charades. The acting player uses the tiny hands to act out the clue on the Challenge card while the other players try to guess the answer. You can add a one- or two-minute time limit, if you want. The player who guesses right gets one point, and so does the acting player. The first player to earn five points wins.

Name: Montana: Goldrush
Description:
Rumors are told that gold can be found in the mountains!

Build settlements next to the mountains in Montana: Goldrush to claim your spot and get a chance to gain some extra wealth. New settlements can be built, which can be used to gain extra benefits or to hinder others. Also, new landscapes with their own special rules bring more variety to the game. Finally, events will change the flow of the game. Some events give players a bonus while others make actions harder.

—description from the publisher

Name: Middle-Earth Strategy Battle Game: Armies of the Lord of the Rings
Description:
The Armies of The Lord of The Rings is an expansion for the Middle-earth Strategy Battle Game that enables you to recreate your favourite scenes from The Lord of the Rings Motion Picture Trilogy with your collection of Citadel and Forge World models. It includes all the information you need to take control of all the Heroes and armies on the tabletop – included in the 244-page hardback:


     16 army lists for the forces of Good, including a brief background, points values, characteristics, special rules and Heroic Tiers for the following: The Fellowship, The Shire, The Rangers, Númenor, Minas Tirith, The Fiefdoms, The Dead of Dunharrow, Arnor, Rohan, Wildmen of Druaden, Rivendell, Lothlórien, Fangorn, The Misty Mountains, The Kingdom of Khazad-dûm, and Wanderers in the Wild;
     11 army lists for the forces of Evil , including a brief background, points values, characteristics, special rules and Heroic Tiers for the following: Barad-dûr, Angmar, Mordor, Moria, Isengard, The Easterlings, Variags of Khand, The Serpent Horde, Far Harad, Corsairs of Umbar, and Sharkey's Rogues;
     11 Narrative Play Scenarios based on pivotal battles: The Last Alliance, The Fall of Khazad-dûm, The Fall of Arnor, Ambush at Amon Hen, Ambush at Ithilien, The Deeping Wall is Breached, Last March of the Ents, Paths of the Druadan, The Black Ships, The Battle of Pelennor Fields, and The Battle of Bywater;
     A full Allies Matrix, showing which factions can work together;
     Army Bonuses for every faction;
     269 profiles, providing rules for your favourite Heroes, Villains, Monsters and Warriors.


—description from the publisher

Name: Monkey Moves Game
Description:
The monkeys can do it all. Upside-down. Mirroring. On one foot. In the air. They have balance, flexibility, and strength... but so do you.

Monkey Moves is the ultimate game to test your trust, coordination, and ability to have fun. Pair with a fellow monkey and get your body moving to mimic the monkey moves on each card. The game is in your hands as you and your partner strategize to earn more points than your opponents. Calibrate on Level 1, risk it with Level 2, or jump straight into challenging Level 3 moves; higher level moves are harder, but worth more points. And remember, it’s always worth trying the move, or your opponents can try to steal.

Are YOU up to the challenge?

—description from the designer

Name: Starcadia Quest: Build-a-Robot
Description:
Starcadia Quest: Build-a-Robot brings not only a whole new branching campaign, monsters, heroes and Upgrades, but it’s also a modular expansion that introduces companion Robots, a new system that can be added to any Starcadia Quest Scenario!

—description from the publisher

Contains:
- Rulebook
- Campaign Sheet Pad
- 13 Highly-Detailed Plastic Miniatures
- 38 Cards
- 30+ Tokens
- 3 Game Tiles
- 4 Robot Dashboards

Name: Crane & Wave: Samurai at War
Description:
A card driven Wargame, winning several awards in the 2018 Wargame PnP Contest:
 3rd Place: Best Overall Game
2nd Place: Best Artwork
2nd Place: Best Overall Rules
2nd Place: Best 2+ Player Game
2nd Place: Best Short/Quick/Small Game
2nd Place: Best New Designer
3rd Place: Most Original Concept

SUMMARY
Japan in 1567, at the height of the Sengoku Jidai – the Age of Warring States. Powerful Samurai families each have conquered large parts of Japan, and the days of the last Ashikaga Shogun in Kyoto are numbered. By land and sea, many more battles will befall the already war-torn country. And soon, one of the many DaimyÅs – the Samurai Warlords – might unite enough regions of Japan under his banner, to call himself the new Shogun. Who will be the first to quench his thirst for power, and start a dynasty to shape Japan for the centuries to come?

GOAL
Become the greatest of the Samurai, by controlling Kyoto and large parts of Japan.

GAMEPLAY
Players draw cards to place armies, attack or fortify provinces and send out agents to sabotage their enemies. The more powerful players become, the more cards they may draw, but the less control they have over which cards to keep.

Every now and then, an Event Card will bring change to the war. The biggest of which is the arrival of the Europeans, who bring firearms and Christianity with them, opening up new possibilities to the players.

Name: Beard Ball
Description:
The game of skill, style and sticky whiskers! There have always been countless reasons why having a beard is better than not having a beard - the beard gives you a strange power that will improve your life, your thoughts will look deeper and more developed with a beard, a beard can make a hipster’s nerdy shirt look cool. Now there’s one more for the list – Beards make the perfect backdrop for a fun party game!

The game centers around completing stunts with three different fake beards. On a turn, two players (either as a team or two cooperating competitors) will try to complete one of the many stunts represented on the cards in the game. Each card provides details about the challenge, the number of attempts allowed, and how many points the stunt is worth.

One player puts on a fake beard with a set of glasses, while the other grabs the plastic balls that are covered in Velcro. The team then follows the instructions given on the card, often trying to get the ball caught on the beard. If they succeed in the designated number of attempts, then both players (or the team) score the points!

Play continues until one player (or team) reaches 11, and he/she/they are the winners!

Contents include - 50 beard ball stunt cards, 5 beard balls, 3 stylish beards of varying difficulty levels, 1 pair of glasses, 1 Bearded die, 1 game board, and instructions

Name: Small Sugar Mill
Description:
A new one of micro-game series made by Jog Kung.

In this game, each player try to arrange the production line in his/her factory, the one who completes more lines and makes the longer pipeline transport will earn more points and win the game!

The game contains two or three rounds according to the number of players. During each round 9 cards are drawn to form a common card row.  Each player then takes a turn to pick a card from either end of that common row, and then places the card to expand the production line in his/her factory.

When there are 10 cards in each player's factory, the game ends and compare each players' score.

Name: Hostage Negotiator: The Tin Man
Description:
Negotiator Cards each add a power that can be used once per game. The Tin Man allows getting additional Conversation card before pivotal event.

This card is a Secret Promo Card for Hostage Negotiator.

Name: Mini Madness Cthulhu: The Arkham Investigation
Description:
Deep inside the vicious mind of the elder gods, resides the madness of mankind. You are not an ordinary person, have seen many things, gaze at the abyss of your own mind, many must called you liar, crazy, even a fraud, but now, the madness that you spoke of, trapped in the nightmares of your soul, broke free into our world, and bring something ancient, evil... and hungry.

Welcome to the Mini Madness Cthulhu - The Arkham Investigation - a mini 9 card game self published, that have elements of Cthulhu's and other H.P Lovecraft histories, as well cosmic horror creatures and elements.

As a Free PNP (print an Play), Solitaire or cooperative game, your goal is to save the world from being devoured by the Ancient Gods, to do that you must collect artifacts and clues, yet it seems simple. To "win" (survive) the game you'll have to fight the cultists, monster and the "Chaos Die", and be able to stay unharmed and mentally fine.

In this game, you have resources, and have to travel from the cards and resolve it rolling dice. Be aware of each ability from every one of the four investigators. As the game proceed the Ancient God will slowly awaken, and make things more difficult. As you collect the symbols "elder signs" you may have the specific amount of the chosen Elder God, when you do so, you beat the game, and save the world - HURRAY! - but... for how much time?

---

No fundo das mentes viciosas dos Deuses Anciões, reside a loucura da humanidade. Você não é uma pessoa comum, viu muitas coisas, olhou para o abismo da sua própria mente, muitos devem chamar-lhe mentiroso, louco, ou até mesmo uma fraude, mas agora, a loucura de que você falou, presa nos pesadelos de sua alma , se libertou em nosso mundo, e trouxe algo antigo, maligno ... e faminto.

Bem-vindo ao Mini Madness Cthulhu - A Investigação Arkham - um mini-jogo de nove cartas auto publicado, que tem elementos de Cthulhu e outras histórias de H.P Lovecraft, bem como criaturas e elementos de terror cósmico.

Como um PNP gratuito (Imprima e Jogue), jogo solo ou cooperativo, seu objetivo é salvar o mundo de ser devorado pelo Deuses Antigo, para isso você deve coletar artefatos e pistas, parece simples, eu garanto a você que não é. Para "vencer" (sobreviver) o jogo você terá que lutar contra os cultistas, monstros e o "Dado do Caos", e ser capaz de permanecer ileso e mentalmente bem.

Neste jogo, você tem recursos e precisa viajar dos cards resolvê-los rolando os dados. Esteja ciente de cada habilidade de cada um dos quatro investigadores. À medida que o jogo avança, o Deus Antigo despertará lentamente e tornará as coisas mais difíceis. Ao coletar os símbolos "Elder Signs" você pode ter a quantidade específica do Deus Ancião escolhido, quando você faz isso, você vence o jogo e salva o mundo - OBAAAA! - mas ... por quanto tempo?

Name: Theft of the Century
Description:
Have you always dreamt of being one of the thieves in Ocean's Eleven? Or perhaps with participating in the Sting? Would you like to be a cat burglar and live la dolce vitta? Then Theft of the Century is the game for you!

Your mission in Theft of the Century will be to escape the police hunting you at every turn. The police will be faster or slower depending on the cards played by your opponents. With a hand management system where you can draw or play cards to make your thief run faster, that make the police quicker when chasing your rivals, and that will combine with each other to earn you points. Play hidden cards to solve at the end of each round, trump your opponent’s strategies and get the most valuable booty!

The game is played in a variable number of rounds, with an objective card that marks the end of the game. Players will use their cards and solve their effects, up to a maximum of 4 cards each round per player. The player who achieves more objectives will be the winner of the game. Will you be the thief who performs the Theft of the Century?

—description from the publisher

¿Siempre soñaste con ser uno de los ladrones de Ocean’s Eleven? ¿O tal vez con participar en El Golpe? ¿Te gustaría ser un ladrón de guante blanco y vivir la dolce vittta? ¡Entonces El Robo del Siglo es el juego para ti!.

En el Robo del Siglo tu misión será huir de la policía que intentará darte caza en cuanto tenga ocasión. La policía será más rápida o más lenta en función de las cartas que vayan jugando tus compañeros. Con un sistema de gestión de mano de cartas donde podrás robar o jugar cartas que harán que tu ladrón corra más, que la policía persiga más rápido a tus rivales, y que harán combos entre sí para conseguir puntos. Apuesta cartas ocultas para resolver al final de cada ronda, entorpece a los ladrones enemigos y ¡consigue el botín más valioso!.

El juego consta de un número de rondas variables en función de una carta objetivo que marca el final de la partida. Los jugadores irán jugando cartas y resolviendo sus efectos, hasta un máximo de 4 turnos por ronda y por jugador. El jugador que consiga más objetivos será el ganador de la partida ¿Serás tú el ladrón que consiga realizar El Robo del Siglo?

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

Name: Mr. Jack: Extension
Description:
October, 1888 — Whitechapel, London: Jack's shadow still hangs heavy over the back-streets of the East End. Scotland Yard has assigned Inspector Abberline to take over the investigation, aided by five new detectives with extraordinary abilities. The new recruits include the formidable Professor Moriarty, who uses his intelligence and cunning to impersonate the other detectives. Is he trying to put Jack off his stride, or to outwit his rival Sherlock Holmes? Or could he even be Jack himself, disguised as Moriarty? Who is the elusive Jack? The unrelenting manhunt continues!

Mr. Jack: Extension is an expansion for the Mr. Jack deduction game that features refreshed artwork for the tenth anniversary of the game as well as an original character as strong as it is enigmatic: Professor Moriarty, whose special ability is to imitate one of the characters who is not at stake.  Moriarty is quite the chameleon, impersonating the other detectives by mimicking their appearance and using their abilities!

This expansion lets you play with six new characters: meet the sultry Madame, flee the terrifying Pizer, avoid the revolutionary Joseph Lane's barricade, dodge Inspector Abberline's probing questions, bound along London's streets with the Spring-Heeled Man, and watch out for Moriarty. At the start of the game, choose which of the eight characters to play with via a draft and determine their starting locations. These new possibilities add fun and strategic depth.

Whether playing as Jack or the Detective, master them all to win!

—description from publisher

Name: Mr. Jack Pocket: Extension
Description:
Mr. Jack Pocket: Extension, the first expansion for Mr. Jack Pocket, features three new characters and a new detective: Mycroft Holmes with a special ability.

With three new alibis, the game will be played on a large London consisting of twelve areas (street tiles) instead of nine as in the base game. More suspects? The investigation looks harder... Fortunately a new detective comes to lend us a hand: Mycroft, the famous brother of Sherlock Holmes!

—description from publisher

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Return to the Dunwich Legacy
Description:
You thought the cases were closed, relegated to a past that was best left forgotten. Beginning with a search for two missing Miskatonic University professors, your inquiries in The Dunwich Legacy launched you on a campaign that led from the decrepit streets of Dunwich to the infamous Clover Club and realms beyond. But questions from these strange investigations still linger, compelling you to board the train to Dunwich once more.

Return to the Dunwich Legacy invites you to re-open your old cases and experience the first full-length campaign for Arkham Horror: The Card Game with fresh eyes as you encounter new challenges and new surprises. Across this expansion’s 81 new scenario cards and 23 new player cards, you’ll explore new locations, face more ghastly treacheries, and enhance your investigator’s abilities as you face even more unspeakable terrors. Finally, Return to the Dunwich Legacy also features a premium box and thirty-two divider cards to conveniently store your complete campaign in one place.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – The Dunwich Legacy
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Snakes & Ladders: Unleashed
Description:
Snakes and Ladders: Unleashed is a fast-paced dice game with a continuously evolving board layout and movable snakes and ladders.

Players try to improve their chances of gaining ground faster, whilst at the same time trying to block their opponents’ progress. This is done by placing their cards on the board and moving snakes and ladders around.

Two dice make the game more tactical, and the chain of potential events makes for a fun and sometimes chaotic game.

Name: DUSK: Arena of Shadows
Description:
Dusk is a dark fantasy combat game based around large models, tactical movement, and deck construction mechanics.

Players will field a single Phantom avatar then take turns constructing decks from a selection of Phantom specific gifts, universal skills, and universal weapons. Each option has 9 potential picks of which players will choose 4 cards to add to a basic deck. All basic decks are 13 cards and identical for parity and balance.

Once decks are constructed players will use the numbers on cards to engage in arena combat at exact ranges while managing their hand size and card abilities to leverage their specific construction strategy.

Fighting in teams or (1 v 1) the game ends when you have eliminated your opponents and established your dominance in the Arena of Shadows.

Name: Frontier: The Card Game – Badlands
Description:
Frontier Badlands is the add-on expansion to Frontier The Card Game!

Frontier Badlands features more player interaction, including dueling, stealing player's supplies using the Lasso, trading every turn, rigorous challenges once you've beaten the game, fun variants, and much more!

When you explore the Badlands, you'll encounter Martians, Ghost Bandits, the Thunderbird, and a slew of other opponents! Manage brand new supplies such as Cattle, the Gatling Gun and even the Martian's Vaporizer! Ward off calamities with Horseshoes, take down enemies with the Shotgun, and earn Legendary Notoriety; they don't call this the Badlands fer' nothin'!

-description from designer

Name: Tavern Masters: Dockside Expansion
Description:
Tavern Masters: Dockside Expansion is the latest expansion for Tavern Masters.

Tavern Masters: Dockside adds in a fourth main Drink type: Rum, and brings in more Sailor-type Patrons and Staff, as well as a new host of regulars and some fun new Goods!

This new Dockside Expansion adds in 30 new Tavern cards and 30 new Patron cards, as well as 12 new Dirty Deeds cards, a 40 card Song deck, and a 20 card Port deck; for a total of 132 new cards!

The Tavern Masters: Dirty Deeds Expansion is not required to use the Dockside Expansion, however the Dockside Expansion also comes with a few patrons, goods, staff and Dirty Deeds that you can choose to include in your game. To include those particular cards, you must use the Dirty Deeds Expansion.

-description from designer

Name: Flames of War: Battle of Stalingrad – War on the Eastern Front
Description:
Stalingrad is your introduction to the exciting world of Flames Of War, the world's most popular World War II miniatures game.

The Flames Of War 'Start Here' booklet is designed to get you playing Flames Of War as soon as possible. Glue your tanks together, grab some dice, a tape measure and an opponent and follow the instructions in this booklet to play a simple game. Once you get the hang of the basic rules in this booklet, you can delve into the full rules and start playing larger, more detailed games.

Once you've played a few games and have a solid grasp of the rules you might find yourself wanting to expand your force with infantry, artillery, aircraft, or even a second unit of tanks! Flames Of War has rules and models that cover all of this, and more, and is available both online and in your local gaming store.

Contains:

1x Plastic Panzer III Tank
    1x Plastic Panzer IV Tank
    1x Plastic KV Tank
    1x Plastic T-34 Tank
    1x Plastic Valentine Tank
    2x Plastic Tank Commander Sprues
    1x Flames of War Mini Rulebook
    1x Flames of War 'Start Here Booklet'
    2x Terrain Cards
    6x Dice
    9x Unit Cards

Name: DOSA
Description:
DOSA is a skill game using MagDrop Technology. Players try to score high by throwing the DOSA discs, and have them MagDrop on the game boards. A MagDrop happens when the disc lands on the board without moving even a fraction of an inch!

The game is played over five rounds. Each round, each player throws the three discs, one at a time. Each disc is scored when it lands. After five rounds, the player with the highest total wins!

The game comes with 4 square game boards, 3 DOSA discs, 1 bag for carrying the game, 1 scoring pad, 20 silicone stickers to help keep the boards in place. Can you MagDrop?

Name: Candy Crush: The Boardgame
Description:
The most fun and tasty game, now playable with up to 4 players! Gather all the different candies and hurry up to be the first to collect the cherry. Test your creativity and create a magical chain of candies to reach the cherry in the middle of the game board. But be aware of your opponents, because when 3 of the same candies connect, your plan will fall apart! Is luck on your side and are you tactical enough to win the candy crush board game?

Candy Crush the board game is a 2 to 4 players strategic board game. The game is played with 6 dice all containing 6 different colors of candies. Players roll all dice a maximum of three times in their turn and try to roll as many of the same colors. Depending on the dice result, players place a number of candy tokens on the board. These can be place either on their own board or that of their opponents. The first player to reach the cherry in the middle of the board by placing enough candy tokens wins the game. But remember that your candy tokens will disappear when an opponent places 3 of the same candies on your board.

-description from publisher

Name: Fleet 1715 Solo
Description:
This edition combined the original base game deck and rules, and the expansion set and rules, in one tinned pack. The tin looks like a suitcase and simply holds the base game and expansion cards and both sets of rules. No other changes.

User summary

The above description seems to be incorrect concerning the contents of the game. The back of the 'tin box' states that the game includes 64 cards for 16 puzzles in different difficulties. That's exactly what the box contains (apart from a sheet which you can copy for solving the puzzles). So no expansion set and rules 'originally'.

Name: Spyfall: Produce Farm promo cards
Description: This promo pack adds ten Produce Farm location cards and two Spy cards.

Name: Zombicide: Green Horde – North the Halfling
Description:
1 North the Halfling Exclusive Survivor figure and ID card.

“Don't hide from curiosity! Throw open the door! ...Well, unless you hear zombies behind it.”

Background:
North's true name is somewhat unpronounceable by humans, so he shortened it for his friends' benefit. As he was born with an unerring sense of direction (even on the darkest nights or beneath thick clouds), the moniker fits perfectly. If there's a beating heart to their ragtag group, it's North. His song and stories keep them going, no matter the odds. North wanted nothing more than to journey the world, see new sights, and meet everyone he could find. The zombie menace has not deterred his ambitions.

Skills:
Blue +1 free Search Action 
Yellow +1 Action 
Orange +1 die: Combat, Slippery 
Red +1 free Move Action, Lucky

Body slot - This slot may hold a Torch instead

Name: World of Tanks: Rush – PzKpfw I
Description: World of Tanks: Rush — PzKpfw I, a promotional card for the World of Tanks: Rush base game available at conventions and through hobby stores, features a light German tank that costs 1, provides no resources, and has a Recruitment ability.

Name: World of Tanks: Rush – БТ-2
Description: World of Tanks: Rush — Ð‘Ð¢-2, a promotional card for the World of Tanks: Rush base game available at conventions and through hobby stores, features a light Soviet tank that costs 1, provides no resources, and has a Scouting ability.

Name: Master of Orion: The Board Game – Galactic Convention Promo Card
Description:
After building for 3 Food and 2 Production:
Gain 2 VP for each of your sets of 4 basic card types (each card may be a part of only one set).

Name: Hippos Love Sushi
Description:
You and your hippo friends have just discovered a restaurant in the jungle. The kitchen is fully stocked and none of those pesky humans are around! As culinary connoisseurs, you decide to take a shot at the menu. However, as you know, too many hippo chefs can ruin the sushi. So choose your meals wisely, and you just might end up with the fattest belly.

Hippos Love Sushi is a bluï¬ƒng/memory game for 2-4 players ages 5 and up, where players take turns adding secret ingredients to Meals. Afterward, each player chooses a Meal to eat. Each player scores 1 point for each correct ingredient in his Meal. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

-description from designer

Name: Gobs of Jobs
Description:
Gobs of Jobs is a game about earning money and what to do with it! Save it? Spend it? Give it? Yes to all three!

Save up for something big and important. Treat yourself and have some fun. Help others and make a difference.

The goal of the game is to earn the most money and use it for Saving, Spending, and Giving. The player with the highest money total on their cards wins.

Name: Gelatinous Cubes Devour the World
Description:
Welcome to Gelatinous Cubes Devour The World from Wrectangle Games! In this game, you are finally able to live out your life-long fantasies of being a Gelatinous Cube. Famished from your travels underground, you emerge to devour the most delicious delicacies you can find – people. Travel from village to village eating everything in your path, or test your slimy grit against the heavily fortified Castle. The first player to masticate their way to 500 points wins!

Players create a world map (random each time) then move their Cubes through this world eating the most villagers by rolling dice to beat skirmish cards drawn when entering a village or castle.

What’s Included:

     Player avatars: (6) translucent color cubes(Red, Green, Blue, Yellow, Orange, Purple)
     D6 Dice: (2) – 6 sided dice for working out Skirmishes
     Map Tiles: (12)
     Skirmish Cards: (54)
     Slime Tokens & Negative Modifiers: Punch cards with colored 
     Slime Tokens for each player color and punch cards with “-1” Negative Modifiers


—description from the publisher

Name: Battle For Souls: Just Got Played
Description:
A special Sin card from Just Got Played‘s Promo card giveaway.

“Three times per game, you may draw three Sin cards, keep your favorite, and shuffle the other two back when you purchase or win a Sin card.”

Name: Sombreros
Description:
Sombreros is a basic shedding and bluffing game. The main components are 25 plastic sombrero-shaped hats, each concealing a sticker in one of five colours.

At the beginning of each round, players are dealt a set of hats and three hats are placed on the table. The player in turn to play may conditionally peek at the colour of a lone hat, and must then place one of their hats on one of the three piles, calling out a colour as they do so. Stating a colour is purely psychological though, as the player is only required to match colours with the hat underneath and whatever is said is disregarded entirely when confirming this. It is also possible to pass at the cost of taking a hat from the "deck".

Another player may challenge a placement, at which point the newly placed hat and the one underneath are inspected to see if they match. In typical bluffing game fashion, whichever of the challenged and challenging player is in the wrong is penalized by having to pick up the entire pile in question, and the other continues play by beginning a replacement pile.

The goal of each round is to be the first player to get rid of all hats, at which point the other players get penalty points based on the hats they still hold. The player with the least penalty points after three rounds wins the game.

—description from the publisher game submitter

Name: Courier
Description:
Courier is a game in which 2 to 4 players become employees of Hoot Deliveries and must deliver goods faster and more accurately than other employees for the COTY (Courier of the Year) award. Courier is an abstract strategy game. Despite its compact configuration, deep gaming, and cute artwork will fascinate you.

From cereals ordered by someone at a cottage in the deep woods to a winter coat to be delivered by a huge department store, deliver them safely, accurately and successfully!

Players must ship their assigned delivery boxes to a town consisting of 3x3 tile layout. Players move their Courier in town first when it's their turn and then place own of their delivery boxes on the extra tile and push it into the line where their own Courier is in town. This could lead to the other delivery boxes being pushed out of town. Players have to push their delivery boxes into town and push the other player's boxes out of town. When delivery boxes of one kind of color is lined up, its owner obtains a score token.

Excellent Courier of the Year is you!

-description from the publisher

Name: Surfer
Description:
Surfer is a game which 2 to 4 players compete to decide who is the best surfer. Surfer's box size is compact, but the fun and party atmosphere it brings is never compact.

Aloha~ welcome to Surfer’s heaven, “Hoot Island.”
Did you happen to hear the rumor of the legendary wave “Tanju”?
Then, get on the surfboard.
If you want to prove yourself the best surfer!

Every round, the dice are rolled and it creates new waves. Players can move surfers on their turn and have different results depending on their choice. Surfers can get a small score on the waves near the beach, or go out to the sea a little further to get a bigger score. It all depends on the choice of the player and perhaps luck.

Are you ready to become the best surfer in Hoot island?

-description from the publisher

Name: Meeple Steeple
Description:
The King has ordered the construction of a new steeple! Can your team of builders meet the task? Use smart play and nerves of steel to construct the King’s steeple as efficiently as possible. Hazards abound and if the steeple collapses during construction or if there are insufficient workers to complete the job you will have failed your King!

Meeple Steeple is a cooperative stacking game played over a number of turns. A game represents an attempt to complete the construction of the steeple by playing through all 5 levels (decks) and successfully placing the steeple piece on top of the structure without it collapsing. Players fail to win if the steeple collapses or if the shared worker pool runs out before playing the steeple piece. You must exercise efficient use of your workers while also using smart play and steady hands to succeed!

-description from designer

Name: Furtherance
Description:
Furtherance is a card-driven engine-building and tactics game for 1-4 players.

Inspired by numerous real-time strategy games, Furtherance puts you in the throne of your very own fantasy kingdom, while simplifying the concept of a civilization game down to only 6 basic actions and straightforward, card-driven, tactical combat.

In Furtherance, you will use your workers to gain gold, acquire cards from a shared marketplace, and research to acquire private technology that only you can buy (while manipulating upcoming technology in the market).

Once a player's actions are selected, they may move and attack with their units. Units can be used to defend a player's castle, attack other players, or complete specific goals to earn victory points.

Victory points are acquired by accomplishing goals to better your kingdom. You can choose to take control of the center of board, prove you can keep your civilians safe during times of war, build immaculate parks, or even fulfill the quest for the Holy Grail, there are many strategies you can pursue to achieve victory.

Assymetric player powers make each play unique. Leader drafting happens at the beginning of the game, starting with the player who goes last and ending with the first player. There are 10 unique leaders including one that gives you extra turns throughout the game, one that lets you buy "blindly" off the top of a deck, and one that lets you increase the maximum health of your units.

Between the ever-changing market, the unique leaders, and the constant unit interactions, every game of Furtherance is different! And, with the streamlined action system and rules, it takes less than 15 minutes to learn and 30 minutes per player to play.

Furtherance can also be played in solo mode. In solo mode, the lone player must defend their castle from ever growing armies in an attempt to make their mark on history by acquiring enough victory points to win before they become overwhelmed with enemies.

Name: Blood Red Skies: British – Bristol Blenheim Mk IV Bomber
Description:
The Bristol Blenheim was originally developed from a design for a fast civil airliner. At the outbreak of WW2 Blenheims formed the mainstay of the RAF Bomber squadrons fighting over Europe and went on to see action in Africa, Asia and even on the Eastern front.

Over four thousand Blenheims were built before it was retired in favour of newer designs.

Contains:

3 x Bristol Blenheim MkIV British Bomber
    3 x Decal sheet
    3 x Advantage Flying Base and extension
    3 x Double-sided Pilot Skill discs
    1 x Aircraft Card
    1 x Assembly instruction leaflet
Families: Game: Blood Red Skies – Royal Air Force

Name: Blood Red Skies: Soviet – Tupolev ANT-40 (SB-2) Bomber
Description:
Although an advanced design in the 1930's the Tupolev SB-2 was rapidly becoming obsolete when hostilities began in 1941. Over 6000 had been built, but a few survived the first year of invasion and the survivors were withdrawn from the front line service in 1942.

Contains:

3x Soviet Tupolev SB-2 Bomber
    3x Decal sheet
    3x Advantage Flying Base and extension
    3x Double-sided Pilot Skill discs
    1x Aircraft Card
    1x Assembly instruction leaflet
Families: Game: Blood Red Skies – Soviet Air Force

Name: Blood Red Skies: Soviet Liszunov Li-2 Transport Aircraft
Description:
The American C-47 Skytrain (Dakota to RAF) was a militarised redesign of the civilian DC-3 airliner, highly valued for its rugged endurance.

Under lend-lease agreements with the Soviet Union, the redesign DC-3 became the Li-2 Transport with the notable turret defence now included.

Contains:

3 x Soviet Liszunov Li-2 Transport Aircraft
    3 x Decal sheet
    3 x Advantage Flying Base and extension
    3 x Double-sided Pilot Skill discs
    1 x Aircraft Card
    1 x Assembly instruction leaflet
Families: Game: Blood Red Skies – Soviet Air Force

Name: Blood Red Skies: Junkers JU-52 – German Transport Aircraft
Description:
The venerable 'Tante Ju' (Auntie Ju) was slow and outdated at the beginning of WWII but it soldiered on as the Luftwaffe's most ubiquitous transport plane throughout the war.

The JU-52 was reliable and could carry a wide variety of loads, from much-needed equipment to the elite airborne troops - the Fallshirmjager!

Contains:

3 x Junkers JU-52 German Transport Aircraft
    3 x Decal sheet
    3 x Advantage Flying Base and extension
    3 x Double-sided Pilot Skill discs
    1 x Aircraft Card
    1 x Assembly instruction leaflet

Name: Monopoly: Winchester
Description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
Located in the heart of Hampshire, the ancient cathedral city of Winchester is one of the oldest settlements in Britain and has a wealth of heritage and history. Dating back to the Iron Age, Winchester was one of Britain's first Roman settlements. This eye-catching city is packed full of culture and is host to the Hat Fair, one of the longest running festivals of outdoor arts and the Theatre Royal. The city has everything you need if you feel the urge for a shopping spree, there is a wide range of independent shops and well-known brands located along the High Street. If you want to grab some fresh air, you can't go wrong with a trip down the River Itchen, and to feel even closer to nature there is the amazing Marwell Zoo. So what are you waiting for? Get ready to roll the dice and play MONOPOLY: Winchester Edition!

PROPERTIES
BROWN
Trinity Winchester / King Alfred's Statue
LIGHT BLUE
City Museum / Westgate Museum / Militry Museums
PINK
The Buttercross / Hat Fair / Theatre Royal Winchester
ORANGE
Jewry Street / High Street / Parchment Jewellers
RED
Chesil Rectory Restaurant / Hampshire Chronicle / Wincester Distillery
YELLOW
Hospital of St Cross / Winchester Science Centre / Marwell
GREEN
Winchester Discovery Centre / 8 College Street / The University Of Winchester
DARK BLUE
The Great Hall / Winchester Cathedral
STATIONS
River Itchen / Winchester Train Station / Winchester Taxi / Stagecoach King's City
UTILITIES
Adam Knibbs Architects / Blue Apple Theatre
TAXES
Income Tax / Luxury Tax

Name: I-GR Making 2
Description:
An idol-themed quirky trick-taking game by Kuro, where the card backs reveal the card's colours.

Cards are dealt, and each round, leader chooses one card from the lineup card from the deck is drawn, and plays a card of a different colour. Then, all other players must play a card of a different colour. Players who can't, discard a card face down.

The lineup card decides whether highest number, lowest number, closest to lineup card, or closest to current round number wins.
The winner is the first to pick cards among the played cards, where he must pick cards that share "star" value. Then the next player gets to pick and so on.

Players then form "groups" out of their gained cards, where each group can only contain one of each colour. The bigger the group, and the higher star values they have, the more points.

User summary

Name: ふるキャン△ (Furu-camp)
Description:
A camping-themed dice-based "first to the mill" game by Kuro. Each round a camping site is drawn, that specifies which die results will give points. Players start each round with one camp member who has a special ability to affect the die roll, Each turn, players either choose to try to go camping (roll the dice and hope for good result), OR pick another camping member with another special ability.

Each camping site has several conditions for points, but most give more points for the first person to fulfill, and less points for the runners-up.

User summary

Name: シュレディンガーの宴 (Schrodinger no Utage)
Description:
ã‚·ãƒ¥ãƒ¬ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ³ã‚¬ãƒ¼ã®å®´ ("Schrodinger's Banquet") is a card game about quantum mechanics.

Players compete for scoring by dividing into two teams, white cats and black cats. However, the players do not have a set team at the beginning of the game. Players work toward the final victory, while also building the two piles and earning their score.

A a turn, the player simply puts one out of three cards in front of someone. Wherever the card is played, the probability of the black cat team or the white cat team written on the card will be added. If this probability exceeds 100%, the player's team is confirmed. Then, when the player's team is confirmed, the points from the card that confirmed the team will be added to the team. The game is over when all players have a confirmed team, or the deck runs out. The team with the most points wins. Even though it is very simple, frustration is bound to happen.

Name: スナップファイターズ (Snap Fighters)
Description:
A monster-bashing cooperative dice dexterity game by Kuro.
Each round, a number of monster boards are set up on the table. Players each have a character with regular and special attack dice. Players will take turns to either flick or throw their attacks so that they land on the monster boards.

Depending on the player's or monster's abilities, each monster will also get a special ability, or weak spot cards attached to them, and if the dice land here, special thing happen.

The game is over when all players are defeated. The score is counted in amount of damage to the city; the less, the better.

User summary

Name: Magic Maze Kids: XXL Playmat
Description:
With this giant game board — the XXL Playmat — Magic Maze Kids is perfect for both children and adults. The game provides great challenges, tortuous paths, and numerous pitfalls.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: General's Handbook 2017
Description:
The General’s Handbook 2017 is the definitive resource for every Warhammer Age of Sigmar gamer. However you play, the book is packed with new content that’ll make your battles more balanced, more exciting and more fun than ever before:

Inside the book, you’ll find:


     Powerful new allegiance abilities for 15 factions, including the Seraphon, Fyreslayers and Hosts of Slaanesh
     Allies rules that allow you to add your favourite models to your army without losing your faction’s Battle Traits
     Updated matched play profiles, including points changes, new battleline units for every army and updated rules of one based on feedback from the community and extensive playtesting
     Tons of new battleplans, including a totally overhauled set of matched play scenarios to test your tactical abilities
     Rules for running multiplayer games, from epic clashes to deceiving your friends in Triumph & Treachery


This book is set to be revolutionary for Warhammer Age of Sigmar – get your copy and get ready for a new era of gaming in the Mortal Realms.

—description from the publisher

Name: Crazy Pirates!
Description:
Players compete as pirates to be the first to collect a treasure and bring it back to their home island. Your pirate must land  exactly on his island: if you roll too high a number, he must “move around” it until you roll the right number to land exactly on the island.

Players move their pirate token and one of four monster tokens on each turn according to the rolls of two different colored dice. Pieces move from point to point on a grid. There are four “whirlpools” at the sides. A pirate can use these whirlpools to jump to one of the other three sides.

Along the way pirates dice-fight each other and a cast of monsters, resulting in transfer of ownership of the treasure or, in the case of the monsters, loss of life.

Game composed of a cardboard game board, 2 wooden dice, 4 cardboard tokens, 4 wooden monsters, 4 wooden boats with a pirate on each and a wooden treasure.

Name: Story Builders
Description:
It's time to go a quest!  What stories will you tell on the way?

Only the crafty will be able to fulfill all their quests before the other.

A drafting game where you can choose to draft a new quest, or draft a new Story Builder.  When you draft a Story Builder, you have to add it your tableau, and once placed, it can never be moved.  In order to complete a quest, you must have it's requirements somewhere in your tableau in a 3-in-a-row.

When you complete a quest, you also can activate it's reward which will do things such as breaking opponent's tableaux or letting you draft extra elements. Completing a quest does not remove its requirements from your tableau, they remain to be used  again in future quests.

The first player to complete 10 quests wins.  Efficient placement of the Story Builder tokens will let you double and triple up their usefulness to finish quests faster.

Name: Lost Stories
Description:
Everywhere you go in human society, just beyond the corner of your eyes and under every step you walk are tendrils of the past, of futures that never happened, of broken things, and of things not born. They’re all lost stories. Some of them can nearly push themselves into reality. Writers, artists, musicians, lovers, and the thin spaces of the minds of the mentally different are all places where a Lost Story can become real in one way or another. Don’t you want to get your sheepskin? Don’t you want to finally be a real story? That’s what all the other Lost Stories call it “Getting the Sheepskin”.

—description from the introduction

The 28 page PDF game document includes 21 pages of print-and-play cards.  Playing the game also requires several ten-sided dice (standard dice can be substituted using an alternate method).  Players take turn in order and player elimination may occur prior to a final win, though winning does not require every player but one be eliminated.

This game was written for, and submitted to, Game Chef 2018.

—user summary

Name: Legend of the Ancients
Description:
In Legend of the Ancients, players will attempt to piece together the greatest legend of a people lost almost entirely to antiquity. By exploring deeper and deeper into the ruins of this lost tribe, they will discover and try to make narrative sense of new elements to the legend, all while hopefully not succumbing to their worst fears. As these things always go, however, there is a catch. Somewhere in the deep, dark underground waits a malevolent force, older than time itself, and with each step they take, our intrepid explorers are unwittingly awakening it. Will our noble adventurers unlock the key to the lost Legend of the Ancients? Or will they be overcome by terror... or something infinitely worse?

—description from the introduction

The cooperative storytelling game is published as an 8-page PDF rules document and a 12-page print-and-play PDF game materials document.  A 1-page, print-and-play DOC file also is included as an errata.  The game uses two distinct decks of cards and a play surface that is randomized at the start of the game.

Play involves drawing map tiles and placing them, to create the randomized playing surface.  Players have a token marking their position on the board.  During each turn, the player selects an action from among six possibilities and executes that action.  Several of the options entail moving the player token to a new map tile.

Players are free to cooperate to achieve game goals, and play is considered cooperative.  Indeed, a few game actions require more than a single player.  Individual players may have leave the game prior to the end of play (they are driven "stark, raving mad"), but this is not common.  Instead, the game ends when the players collectively complete one of two tracks of play (one of the tracks is the "happy" ending - universal success; the other is the "doom" ending - universal failure).

The game is meant to be played with 3 - 5 players; a minor variant rule can be used to adapt the game for 2 players - in effect, the rule creates a dummy, limited, third "player".

The game was written for, and submitted to, Game Chef 2018.

—user summary

Name: Newlandia
Description:
From the back of the box:  Newlandia is a quick and fun game where you build up an island and compete with other players.

Game Play:  Each turn you can either play a card in your play area or discard one card on the top of a corresponding discard pile.  To place cards in your play area, all cards must be placed by ascending order, and cannot be repeated.  You may only put cards with the same color in the same column.  Then you draw the top card from the center pile or a discard pile.

Each column's card values will be totaled.  The totals will be added together to form the final score.  If a column has no number cards, that column has a score of 0.  If a column has number cards, add up the numbers, then subtract 20.  After scoring, the player with the highest score wins the game.

Name: Last Full Measure: The Battles of Aldie, Middleburg, and Upperville
Description:
Alfred Plesanton battles with J. E. B. Stuart's cavalry along the Ashby's Gap Turnpike, trying to determine where Lee's Army of Northern Virginia is going.

The game, now retitled: Last Full Measure: Plesanton's Reconnaissance is a free print-and-play game of the battles of Aldie, Middleburg, and Upperville, June 17th-21st, 1863; the fifth game in the LFM series of battles of the American Civil War.

A brigade scale game that uses regiment counters, as opposed to generic line markers, to spread the brigade over multiple hexes according to it's size. Ranged artillery fire, cavalry charges, command and control, all in only eight pages of rules. Play aids include Player-aid card with CRT and other charts and table; Eliminated Units card, Order of Arrival card, and 240 2-sided counters.

This map measures a long 82" x 24" at a scale of 250 yard per 3/4" hex.  Printed at a reduced scale and 5/8" hexes will make it about 69" long.

All print-and-play files are downloadable at: Uhlan Games

-description from designer

Name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of Normandy – The Untold Stories Vol. 1
Description:
Battles that Tell More than Just a Story

Heroes of Normandy – The Untold Stories Vol. 1 is an expansion module for Lock 'n Load Tactical's Heroes of Normandy. It contains eight new scenarios, plus a bonus scenario in which two scenarios are combined to form a larger one.  The idea for this expansion started from a long desire to tell these stories as well as enjoying hearing them.  One of the many wonderful things with books, comics and of course games is sharing the fun together.  Many hours of storytelling can start off with “Do you remember, or I can’t believe this happened.” It is clear to us we weren’t the only ones who enjoy hearing these stories.  We wanted our stories to be told with characters you know and enjoy playing our games but at the same time if you never played one of our games you would still enjoy reading these stories.  So, a number of the story elements are taken from our Lock ’n Load Tactical game series, specifically the names of leaders, heroes, units, and the occasional moments inspired by our own gameplay.  By doing this it has added a new level to our stories and added the ability and similarity for these men and their stories to live on not just in our games but also in our stories and hearts.

The scenarios do not have to be played in order and are presented here in the same order in which they appear in the book. Most of them can be played in 45 minutes or fewer, and the replay value is high. It was also nice to get the little-used British commando units into some more scenarios.  Three new 4K X-Maps are included that depict the lush Norman countryside, presenting winding streams, tree-lined farms, and a quaint village. Vital bridges need to be destroyed, important villages need to be controlled, daring rescues need to be made and vengeance must be doled out no matter the cost. Heroics, leadership and, as always, luck can mean the difference between victory and defeat. Now you can read or listen to the stories and then play them out on your gaming table!

Requirements:  To play Heroes of Normandy  – The Untold Stories you must own Lock ‘n Load Tactical – Heroes of Normandy.

-description from publisher

Name: Wakening Lair: Doppelganger Promo Card
Description:
Promo card for Wakening Lair distributed at Gen Con 2018 with game purchase.

Doppelganger is a monster card that has use right an unused hero.
